poem:
Title: On the War Footing, Again 

The UK wallet,
heavy with warfare whispers;
values, metal-tinged.
Concrete, men and ammo,
purchased
to soothe a nation's threat-dreams -
Yet, the invitation - may we
dance instead on this footing?
Rehashed as a globe's plea,
with currency of compassion.
Former prime minister,
we heard your voice:
on the right decision,
padded with values
and the silence of X.
